document.docTitle: Libythea myrrha subsp. myrrha myrrha Godart 1819
document.masterDocTitle: <strong> Systematic revision and review of the extant and fossil snout butterflies (Lepidoptera: Nymphalidae: Libytheinae) </ strong>

bibRefCitation.author: Godart, J. B.
bibRefCitation.refString: Godart, J. B. (1819) Genre Libythee. In Latreille, M. & Godart, M. [Eds.], Encyclopedie Methodique, 9. Agasse, Paris. pp. 169 - 171.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Libythea ( Libythea ) myrrha var. myrrhina : Oberthür 1910: 53
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis.
Libythea myrrha myrrha
closely resembles L. m. hecura by sharing similar forewing pattern and a weakly falcate forewing apex. This subspecies differs from the latter in that the forewing orange band between Rs 1 and M 1 is separated from the band between M 1 and M 3 , which is fused in L. m. hecura.

Type Specimens Examined.
Libythea myrrha myrrhina Fruhstorfer 1909
, HOLOTYPE : ♂ , Indonesia : Sumatra , Padang ( BMNH ).
L. myrrha yawa Fruhstorfer 1914
, HOLOTYPE : ♂ , Indonesia : Ost [West] Java , H. Fruhstorfer ( BMNH ).

Distribution. Indonesia : Bali , Java , Lombok, Sumba, Sumbawa, Sumatra , Sultanate of Deli.

Remarks. After examination of types and many specimens from Indonesia , it is apparent that
myrrhina Fruhstorfer
and yawa Fruhstorfer should be synonymized since they cannot be readily distinguished from
myrrha Godart.
